Understate: The claim may understate the context and origin of the quote by not providing enough information about its source and the fact that it was a joke made by Conan O'Brien on his show.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides one source, a Twitter post by Sarah Kendzior, without considering other reports and sources that do not mention this particular quote.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that Ivanka Trump actually said she would "mace" her father without considering the possibility that it was a fabricated or exaggerated quote.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the quote, which is that it originated as a joke made by Conan O'Brien on his show and was not actually said by Ivanka Trump.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Ivanka Trump did not use this joke during the segment on The View, as confirmed by Lauri Hogan, the Publicity Director at ABC Entertainment Group.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the quote by presenting it as a serious statement made by Ivanka Trump, when it was actually a joke made by Conan O'Brien.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing a comprehensive analysis of all available sources and reports related to the alleged quote.
